title: Video Call Fatigue: The Science
description: A short lesson to help you apply Video Call Fatigue: The Science.

hook.text: After four video calls, you're exhausted â€” more than four in-person meetings. Stanford studied why.

buildup.text: Jeremy Bailenson identified four causes: excessive eye contact, seeing yourself, reduced mobility, higher cognitive.

discovery.text: On video, everyone stares at everyone continuously. In person, you'd never maintain that much eye contact.

twist.text: Seeing your own face triggers constant self-evaluation. Hide self-view to reduce 40% of the fatigue.

climax.text: Fixes: hide self-view, use speaker view, take audio-only calls, and build 'no meeting' blocks.

punchline.text: Zoom fatigue is real and measurable. Design your day around it.

quiz.question: What causes video call fatigue according to Stanford research?
options: Excessive eye contact, self-view, reduced mobility, higher cognitive load
